content.description: Start left hand on the crescent crimp and right hand on the sloper pinch on the arete. pull a powerful bump into the large side pull feature and pull in for another powerful move to the sloper/pinch ball hold with your right hand. bump your left hand up or go big to the top with your right and mantle the flat top.
content.location: directly north of full bloom on the north end of the mountain.

content.description: Start at the bottom ed of the boulder on the obvious jug/s and move up and right on juicy crimps and jugs.
content.location: between full bloom and rancho arete.

content.description: Start with your right hand in the obvious mail slot with your left hand on the lowest rounded side pull. with a high and awkward left foot, stab for the pinch, match the pinch/crimp, throw for the solid left hand crimp and power for the top jug. plenty of intermediates.
content.protection: there is a rock bulging into the left part of this climb, making a fall at the top potentially dangerous. be smart.
content.location: hike past cow tipping along the trail until you come to a dead end. walk over the hill of debri and rocks until you come to a paved road. walk the paved road for 100 yards until you can see a dark face on the top of the mountain facing east. it is in this niche up on the hill.

content.description: Start at the far left side of boulder on two obvious chicken-head finger buckets. pull a long reach right to a full pad dorito shaped pinch/crimp. cross to the obvious protruding mushroom disc and fire to gain a poor right hand slimper dish. twist your feet and fire big to the jug and top out up a big hollow plate feature ad onto an easily slab scramble to the narrow top.
content.protection: two pads is sufficient, but the more the merrier.
content.location: hike up the obvious wide trail until you will pass it on your left about ten or fifteen minutes into the trail.

content.description: secluded, hundreds of boulders with no holds or are too small to climb. however there are several gems that should not be overlooked by any tucson boulderer.
